content: Extension and modification of renewable energy production tax credit. Extension of Credit for qualified facilities under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change the date from January 1, 2009, to January 1, 2019. Additionally, there are amendments to the Production Credit for Electricity Produced From Marine Renewables. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy sources such as waves, tides, and currents in oceans, rivers, lakes, and streams. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy sources like waves, tides, and currents in oceans, rivers, lakes, and streams. This encompasses systems, canals, or man-made channels for electric power production, excluding energy derived from dams or diversionary structures. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy sources. A qualified facility for producing electricity from marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy must have a nameplate capacity rating of at least 150 kilowatts and be placed in service between the enactment date and January 1, 2010. The credit rate for such facilities is adjusted accordingly. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy sources with specific requirements for qualified facilities. Amendments are made regarding sales of electricity to regulated public utilities and clarification on trash facility definitions. Effective dates for the amendments are also specified. The amendments made by subsections (a) apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2008. Subsections (b) and (c) apply to electricity produced and sold after the enactment of this Act. Subsection (d) applies to electricity produced and sold before, on, or after December 31, 2007. Extension and modification of solar energy and fuel cell investment tax credit. Extension of solar energy, fuel cell, and microturbine property tax credits to January 1, 2019 and December 31, 2018 respectively. Allowance of energy credit against alternative minimum tax. The tax code is amended to include a new clause related to energy credits and repeals the dollar per kilowatt limitation for fuel cell property. The tax code is amended to include new clauses related to energy credits and repeals limitations for fuel cell property. Amendments involve striking and redesignating certain paragraphs in subsections. Effective dates for the amendments are specified. The tax code amendments related to energy credits and fuel cell property have specific effective dates. Amendments apply to credits determined under the Internal Revenue Code in taxable years after the enactment of the Act. Fuel cell and public electric utility property amendments apply to periods after the Act's enactment. SEC. 3. Extension and modification of residential energy efficient property credit. Extension of the residential energy efficient property credit under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to extend the termination date to December 31, 2018. The maximum credit for solar electric property is modified with no dollar limitation, and the credit is allowed against the alternative minimum tax. The credit allowed for solar electric property is modified with no dollar limitation and can be used against the alternative minimum tax. The credit is limited based on the amount of tax and any unused credit can be carried forward to future years. The credit for solar electric property has no dollar limit and can be applied against the alternative minimum tax. Any excess credit can be carried forward to future years. The excess credit for solar electric property can be carried forward to future years and added to the credit allowable for those years. Amendments are made to various sections of the tax code to include the new credit for solar electric property. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007, and are subject to the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001.
